Class BufferPool.Buffer

java.lang.Object
BufferPool.Buffer
Enclosing class:

public class BufferPool.Buffer extends Object
This class to create an object buffer it is a nested class in the BufferPool class

  • Constructor Details

    • Buffer

      public Buffer(boolean dirtyBitMark, int bufSize, int bID)
      Buffer constructor to instantiate a buffer object in the list of buffer pools
      Parameters:
      dirtyBitMark - boolean parameter to set the dirty bit field in the buffer
      bufSize - integer parameter to set the buffer size which is a block of bytes, i.e., multiple of 4 bytes records
      bID - integer parameter to set the block ID of buffer content

    • Buffer

      public Buffer(byte[] blk, boolean dirtyBitMarker, int buferSize, int blockID)
      Buffer constructor with block value to instantiate a buffer object in the list of buffer pools
      Parameters:
      blk - byte array that set value of block object in the buffer
      dirtyBitMarker - boolean parameter to set the dirty bit field in the buffer
      buferSize - integer parameter to set the buffer size which is a block of bytes, i.e., multiple of 4 bytes records
      blockID - integer parameter to set the block ID of buffer content

  • Method Details

    • getBuffSize

      public int getBuffSize()
      Getter buffer size
      Returns:
      buffSize integer value of buffer size, i.e., block size

    • setBufferContents

      public void setBufferContents(byte[] bufContents, int blkId)
      Setter buffer contents with block ID
      Parameters:
      bufContents - array of bytes included in the buffer, i.e., block content
      blkId - integer number of the block ID number

    • insertDataIntoBuff

      public void insertDataIntoBuff(byte[] data, int position, int len)
      Insert data within a block at specific positions
      Parameters:
      data - array of bytes that needs to be inserted in a buffer
      position - integer number of the position at buffer to insert data
      len - integer number of data.length to be inserted in the buffer

    • getBufferContents

      public byte[] getBufferContents()
      Getter buffer contents
      Returns:
      block array of bytes included in the buffer, i.e., block content

    • getWritingStatus

      public boolean getWritingStatus()
      Getter buffer's writing status
      Returns:
      true if any contents in the buffer changed and false if not

    • getBlockID

      public int getBlockID()
      Getter buffer's content Block ID
      Returns:
      integer value of the Block ID
